Club](http://web.archive.org/web/20150302160520/http:/www.letterheadfonts.com/fonts/athleticclub.php), [Eriq (Jaffe)'s Sports Fonts collection](http://web.archive.org/web/20150302160520/http:/eriqjaffe.50webs.com/)
Thanks for all the choices. Looking to tackle the exact font.Any other suggestions ?

Actually, there are at least 2 different typefaces. I can see 2 different /E ( [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20150302160520/http:/typophile.com/files/w7_3558.jpg) and [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20150302160520/http:/typophile.com/files/w4_4242.jpg)), /M ( [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20150302160520/http:/typophile.com/files/w7_3558.jpg) and [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20150302160520/http:/typophile.com/files/w4_4242.jpg)) and /R ( [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20150302160520/http:/typophile.com/files/w4_4242.jpg) and [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20150302160520/http:/typophile.com/files/w3_5919.jpg)) and I don't know any font with such a [double-sided /G crossbar](http://web.archive.org/web/20150302160520/http:/typophile.com/files/w6_5083.jpg). Have you look at everything I listed?

Actually, there are at least 2 different typefaces. I can see 2 different /E ( [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20150302160520/http:/typophile.com/files/w7_3558.jpg) and [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20150302160520/http:/typophile.com/files/w4_4242.jpg)), /M ( [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20150302160520/http:/typophile.com/files/w7_3558.jpg) and [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20150302160520/http:/typophile.com/files/w4_4242.jpg)) and /R ( [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20150302160520/http:/typophile.com/files/w4_4242.jpg) and [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20150302160520/http:/typophile.com/files/w3_5919.jpg)) and I don't know any font with such a [double-sided /G crossbar](http://web.archive.org/web/20150302160520/http:/typophile.com/files/w6_5083.jpg). Have you look at everything I listed?

Actually, the more I look at it the more I think it's a customization of existing typefaces. Nothing is really consistent:  
- "WTAPS": /S should be "slab-serifed" too but it's not, making me thinking they could have started with some " [United Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20150302160520/http:/typophile.com/node/99935#comment-539470)-like", manually adding slab-serifs  
- "LIMA" VS. "WTAPS": nothing matches (different weight, different /A...). "LIMA" is actually matching many "NBA" font from Eriq Jaffe's collection I've already pointed to.  
- /76 counter: also inconsistent with both "WTAPS" and "LIMA" designs. Counter can't be square but hexagonal/faceted if had to match "WTAPS" or /7 would have been bottom serifed to match "LIMA".

Adding [Athletico](http://web.archive.org/web/20150302160520/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/nowak/athletico-clean) Sharp, [Undergrad](http://web.archive.org/web/20150302160520/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/thomas-kaeding/undergrad), [College](http://web.archive.org/web/20150302160520/http:/www.dafont.com/college.font), [College Slab](http://web.archive.org/web/20150302160520/http:/www.dafont.com/college-slab.font) and **[Ivy No.2](http://web.archive.org/web/20150302160520/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontry/greek-font-set-1/ivy-no-2/glyphs.html)** (probably the closest I could get) to the list.
Thank you so much for the input !
